title: Set up GitHub Actions CI with releases and brew instructions
description:
## Tasks
- [ ] Set up GitHub Actions workflow for CI builds
- [ ] Build for macOS ARM64, macOS x86_64, Linux x86_64
- [ ] Investigate Linux ARM64 (cross-compile or QEMU)
- [ ] Attach binaries to GitHub releases
- [ ] Update README.md with installation instructions (brew, binary downloads)

## Notes
- FPC cross-compilation needs RTL units for target platform
- QEMU emulation is a simpler alternative for Linux ARM64
- Homebrew formula could tap a custom repo or use releases

comments.author: Dr. Stefan Schimanski
comments.text:
Cross-compilation test results:

- Tested `fpc -Tlinux -Paarch64 niki.pas` on macOS
- Fails with "Can't find unit system" - RTL units for Linux are not included in Homebrew FPC
- Building cross-compiler RTL requires FPC source and target platform headers
- fpcupdeluxe can set this up but adds complexity

Recommended approach for GitHub Actions:
- Use native runners for macOS ARM64 and x86_64
- Use native Linux x86_64 runner
- For Linux ARM64: either skip initially or use QEMU emulation (slower but simpler)

title: Investigate official Unicode Free Vision (units starting with 'u')
description:
The utf8 TV fork we use mentions on their GitHub page:

> Free Vision has already been ported to Unicode in Free Pascal. So it's probably better to use official implementation (see units with names starting with "u").

Tasks:
1. Find and investigate the official Unicode Free Vision units in Free Pascal
2. Compare capabilities with our current fv_utf8/ fork
3. Determine if we can switch to the official implementation
4. Document what should happen with our patches against the utf8 version:
   - views.pas: 64-bit TDrawBuffer for UTF-8, drag'n'drop screen updates
   - drivers.pas: Mouse event routing fix (keycode 0 -> evNothing)
   - keyboard.pp: SGR 1006 extended mouse protocol parsing
   - mouse.pp: Mouse mode 1002 (button-event tracking) for drag support

title: Field state not restored after program run
description:
After running a program (Ctrl-F9), the field should be restored to its original state. Instead, 'Can't reload temporal file' error appears and the robot remains at its final position instead of returning to the starting position.

This is a pre-existing bug exposed after fixing tvniki-field-click-crash.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open any .pas file
2. Press Ctrl-F9 to run
3. After 'Program finished' message, press Enter
4. Error 'Can't reload temporal file' appears
5. Robot is at final position instead of original position

Expected: Robot should return to starting position after run completes.
